metadata.title: CVE-2022-48708 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:pinctrl: single: fix potential NULL dereference Added checking of pointer"function" in pcs_set_mux(). pinmux_generic_get_function() can return NULLand the pointer "function" was dereferenced without checking against NULL.Found by Linux Verification Center (linuxtesting.org) with SVACE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

No subscription required
